places.name: At The Top, Burj Khalifa

reviews.text:
We had a wonderful experience at the Top. We had checked the reviews about the long lines and this is why we booked the package to the 154 floor. This gives you access to all the floors those are accessible.
It is pricey but then it is all worth at the end. We went for the 5:00 pm time and you are not pushed to go down early. The view from 154 floor and the lookout is just super amazing, worth every cent you spend on the tickets. You are welcomed with a drink and staff is always ready to click your pics.
The lounge has some very delicious food, served by some very polite and courteous staff.
Washrooms are very clean and there is  enough seating up there.
On the 124th floor, there are long lines for the elevators going down, but with Top Floor access, you get priority line to down going elevators too.

A Memorable Visit to Burj Khalifa – At The Top (Levels 124 & 125)

Today, I had the incredible opportunity to visit the Burj Khalifa – At The Top, Levels 124 and 125, and it was truly one of the most unforgettable experiences of my life.

The observation deck at Level 124 offers a breathtaking panoramic view of Dubai that simply cannot be described in words. It's something you have to see to believe. The entire city looked stunning, and we were able to capture countless amazing photos while soaking in the beauty.

Level 125 was equally impressive, featuring unique attractions and interactive experiences. Walking on the glass bridge and experiencing the breaking glass effect was thrilling and added a fun, surprising element to our visit. We shared many laughs and enjoyed every moment.

The staff throughout the visit were exceptionally kind, professional, and helpful. I would especially like to extend my heartfelt thanks to Mr. Awais Hashmi, the Guest Ambassador, whose warm hospitality and insightful guidance made our trip even more enjoyable. His tips and advice truly enhanced our overall experience, and we are deeply grateful.

We left with wonderful memories and are already planning to return next time, aiming even higher!

Thank you once again to the Burj Khalifa team, and a special thanks to " Mr. Awais Hashmi " for making our visit so special.

Unmissable Experience with Outstanding Service – VIP All the Way!

Visiting At The Top at the Burj Khalifa was one of the absolute highlights of our time in Dubai. From start to finish, the experience was seamless, luxurious, and truly awe-inspiring.

The VIP package is absolutely worth it - access to the 154th floor and the exclusive Sky Lounge waiting area makes all the difference. The lounge was peaceful, beautifully designed, and a great way to begin the experience away from the crowds.

The guided tour to the elevator was surprisingly informative - we learned so much about the building's design, construction, and significance. It really added depth and appreciation to the visit.

A special thank you to Nadim in Lounge 154, who delivered exceptional service with such grace and professionalism. He made us feel welcome and well cared for, and his thoughtful attention to detail truly enhanced the experience.

And of course, the views from the top were simply unforgettable - watching the sunset from the tallest building in the world is a memory we'll cherish forever.

If you're visiting Dubai, don't hesitate - go for the VIP package. You won't regret it!

places.address: burj khalifa, Blvd Dubai Unit LG - 089 - Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Blvd, Dubai, United Arab Emirates

sources.snippet: This bridge depicts the knitting of Dubai's unique social fabric throughout the region, serving as a gateway connecting Dubai's rich heritage to its bright future. The bridge connects opposing banks and villages along the canal, transporting tourists across a path that tells us of Dubai's intertwined cultural ties to the rest of the world. The path's curvature is supported by wires that are connected to one edge as it navigates two landing places.

My Photography & Travel Guide to Dubai, UAE — Chasing Hippoz

places.name: Tolerance Bridge

reviews.text: Pretty impressive pedestrian and cycling bridge spanning a feature that effectively makes a chunk of Dubai into an island. The Canal joins the Dubai Creek, which is a natural Inlet to the sea at Jumeira. There are other bridges spanning the Canal but, in my view this one is the most attractive.

The Tolerance Bridge is one of Dubai's most beautiful pedestrian bridges, offering breathtaking views of the Dubai Water Canal, skyline, and Burj Khalifa in the distance. The elegant arch design makes it not just functional but also an architectural landmark. Whether you're walking, jogging, or cycling, the experience here is calming and scenic - especially during sunset or in the cooler evening hours when the bridge lights up.

It's a perfect spot for both tourists and residents to relax, take photos, or simply enjoy the breeze over the canal. The path is clean, wide, and well-maintained, with ramps and railings that make it accessible for all. It's also a great location to catch views of passing boats and soak in the peaceful vibe right in the middle of the city.

The bridge symbolizes unity and harmony, which adds even more meaning to your visit. That said, it's one of those hidden gems that adds to Dubai's charm.

Highly recommended for anyone who appreciates architecture, photography, or just wants to enjoy a quiet moment amidst the city lights.

BETWEEN CITY LIGHTS AND GOLDEN SKIES, THE TOLERANCE BRIDGE OFFERS A VIEW THAT SPEAKS IN CONTRAST AND HARMONY.
This spot truly feels like a hidden gem-calm, relaxing, and perfect for a peaceful escape in the heart of Dubai. You can reach it easily via a direct RTA boat from Al Ghubaiba, and the nearest metro station is Business Bay. The long walkway offers an uninterrupted skyline view on one side, and if you simply turn around, you're greeted by a stunning sunset over the water. Cycling is also an option here, with a Careem bike stand conveniently located nearby. The area is part of the dhow cruise route, so you get to enjoy those elegant boats gliding past as well. And what to say about the Dubai Water Canal? The waterfall there stops automatically when a cruise passes and then starts flowing again-an unforgettable moment that's impossible not to capture on camera. Without a doubt, this is one of the best spots in the city for photography lovers.

places.address: 56QV+8RX, Al Safa - Dubai, United Arab Emirates
